;

;Recently, the news that "in order to allow a 4-year-old boy to settle down, an 18-year-old father appeared for a paternity test" has attracted public attention great concern. According to the Anhui Radio and Television Economic Life Channel, a 4-year-old boy in Hefei, Anhui, Wang Zien, had no one to take care of him and played alone on the street all day long. In order to settle Wang Zien's residence, the child's father, 18-year-old Wang, finally showed up. He said that he was only 14 years old when Wang Zien was born, and the child's mother was 20 years old at the time. The two parties broke up a few months after the child was born, and there has been no contact. He had to leave the child to his father to raise.

;

;After the incident broke out, public opinion mainly focused on Wang giving birth to a child before the age of 14. He was still a child, which was too irresponsible, and the mother of the child was more likely to be suspected of abandoning the child. A lawyer interviewed by the media said that the mother should fulfill her parenting obligations.

;

;These angles cannot be said to be meaningless, but they obviously miss the point. The crux of the problem should be that boys' sexual rights are not protected. According to Wang, he was only 14 years old when the child was born (I don’t know whether he was one year old or not, even if he was one year old, Wang was probably still under 14 years old when they had sex), and the child’s mother was 20 years old. It can be inferred that when having sexual relations, Wang was most likely under 14 years old, while the mother of the child was over 18 years old.

;

;What will happen if the genders are reversed and an 18-year-old man has sex with a girl under 14? I'm afraid online public opinion has already exploded. According to the criminal law, sexual relations with a girl under the age of 14, regardless of whether the girl "consented", will be severely punished as rape. If the circumstances are serious or cause serious consequences, the death penalty may also be imposed.

;

;However, when the genders are reversed and adult women have sex with underage men, the situation becomes very embarrassing. The crime of rape cannot be applied because China's criminal law stipulates that the victim of rape can only be a female. Even if a man is forced to have sex, the other party does not commit the crime of rape. If the boy is under 14 when he is violated, he can be punished as child molestation. However, the penalty for this crime is only a fixed-term imprisonment of less than 5 years. Even if there are bad circumstances or serious consequences, the maximum sentence can only be 15 years in prison. This is not the same as the punishment for rape.

;

;If the male victim is over 14 years old, he is no longer a child. Even if he is forcibly violated, criminal law cannot protect his rights. More importantly, in reality, if a minor male has sexual relations with a female, if the other party is an adult, judicial practice will not consider the male's sexual rights to have been violated.

;

;This is obviously abnormal. Minor males should receive the same protection as minor females.

;

;Quite coincidentally, a case of an adult female teacher sexually assaulting an underage male student recently broke out in Taiwan. Xu, a female teacher who works as a fifth- and sixth-grade primary school teacher, repeatedly sexually assaulted a boy under the age of 14 in her class. She eventually became pregnant and gave birth to a child. The crime was later reported. The judge recently ruled that Xu was guilty of sexual intercourse and forced intercourse with a man under the age of 14, and sentenced her to 17 years and six months in prison.

;

;Analyzing this case, we can find the differences between Taiwan’s criminal laws and mainland criminal laws.

;

;First of all, having sex with a man against his will also constitutes the crime of rape (called "forced intercourse" in Taiwan). According to the criminal regulations revised in Taiwan in 1999, "Men and women who have sexual intercourse by force, coercion, intimidation, hypnosis or other methods against their will shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than 3 years but not more than 10 years." In this case, The judge determined that the female teacher surnamed Xu had sex with a male student twice against the male student's will, so it constituted a crime of forced intercourse.

;

;Secondly, as long as you have sexual intercourse with a child under the age of 14, even if the child is voluntary, it still constitutes a crime (Article 227 of the Criminal Code of Taiwan, "Any person who has sexual intercourse with a man or woman under the age of 14 shall be punished with 3 to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than 10 years but not more than 10 years”). In the above-mentioned case, the judge held that the female teacher named Xu had sexual intercourse with male students on seven other occasions. Although the boys were consenting, Xu's use of the girl still constituted the crime of sexual intercourse with men under the age of 14.

;

;In addition, Taiwan’s criminal regulations also equally protect the sexual rights of minors of men and women over 14 years old but under 16 years old. “Anyone who has sexual intercourse with a man or woman over 14 years old but under 16 years old shall be sentenced to a fixed-term imprisonment of not more than 7 years.” ". That is to say, having sexual relations with minors between the ages of 14 and 16 is also a crime, but the penalty is lighter than having sexual relations with children under 14 years old.  

;

;In mainland criminal law, the protection of men’s sexual rights is much weaker. The sexual rights of minor males over 14 years old (let alone adult males) are not protected by criminal law, and the sexual rights of boys under 14 years old can only be protected by the much weaker crime of child molestation.

;

;There is another point in Taiwan’s criminal laws that we can learn from, that is, multiple crimes can be punished based on the number of crimes committed, and they can be punished simultaneously. In the above-mentioned case, the judge found that Xu had sex with male students nine times. Although they were only divided into two categories, she was still convicted of nine crimes, and finally she was punished for several crimes. In the mainland legal system, only different crimes will be regarded as multiple crimes, the same crime will be classified as one crime, and the number of crimes will only be used as a reference for sentencing. This may result in a lighter sentence.

;

;Looking back at history, before Taiwan revised its criminal laws in 1999, the victims of rape could only be women. If a man was sexually assaulted, the perpetrator could only be held accountable for indecent assault. However, Taiwan revised the relevant regulations more than 20 years ago to provide equal protection for the sexual rights of men and women. This is something the mainland can learn from.

; Mon, 20 Nov 2023 19:25:02 +0800 “游客回家”，一些国际网红城市对过度旅游说不http://www.infzm.com/contents/260941
;;2023-11-20 18:00:00;
;

;"Stop the emergency brake now, otherwise we will be run over."

;

;"For Thinking about our children."

;

;Two months ago, about 100 residents of Hallstatt, Austria, gathered in the tunnel leading to Hallstatt and shouted various slogans to protest against "excessive travel".

;

;The Austrian town of Hallstatt has long been attracting tourists. The tree-lined mountains, the wooden houses towering over the villages, and the sparkling mountain lakes make you forget to leave. However, the town, which receives up to 10,000 visitors a day, is tiring for many of its approximately 800 residents.

;

;;

;

;International internet celebrity tourist cities are overcrowded, and many places have enacted rules to restrict tourists. (Li Chunhua/Photo)

;

;With the recovery of global tourism, the term "overtourism" has reappeared.

;

;On November 8, 2023, at the World Travel Mart, the organizer and Oxford Economics jointly released a new 2023 global leisure tourism report, and pointed out that in 2023, global leisure tourism The total number of tourists only dropped by about 10% compared with 2019 before the epidemic, and the total number of leisure tourists accounted for 60% of the total number of tourists.

;

;Concerns about overtourism appear not only in popular cities such as Austria, Venice, and Bali, but also in other regions such as Hawaii and Greece, Spain, and Japan.

;

;;;;

;

;Dozens of tourists are pouring into Europe's otherwise peaceful country The small town troubles many locals. (Yao Jiatong/Photo)

;

;Local residents are often dissatisfied that the influx of tourists has pushed up local consumption levels and put huge pressure on local infrastructure and urban management. In addition, the uncivilized behavior of some foreign tourists interferes with their daily lives.

;

;In recent years, many international celebrity tourist cities have formulated rules to restrict tourists.

;

;For example, Venice charges a "city entry tax" for day-trippers; the ancient city of Croatia uses cameras to monitor the flow of people and closes its doors as soon as the number of people exceeds 6,000; Iceland restricts local residents from renting out properties for tourists to live in; Machu Picchu only Three fixed tour routes have been opened to foreign tourists...

;

;The United Nations World Tourism Organization stated that from the release of the new crown epidemic to 2030, the number of international tourists is expected to increase by 50 million every year, and the growth will mainly come from Asia.

;

;;“Enough of the huge, noisy tourist groups”;

;

;365 days a year, photographer Chen Chen Half the time is spent traveling.

;

;When he arrived in Austria, the "artistic atmosphere" hit him, which doubled his fondness for the city. When walking on the street, Chen Chen said he couldn't help but stop at what was playing on the big screen of the opera house.

;

;Among them, the small town of Hallstatt is a veritable "Internet celebrity check-in place", located in the Salzkammergut region of Austria. In the past decade, its popularity has skyrocketed due to its use in movies and TV series. At the same time, it is also a world cultural heritage with picturesque scenery, ancient salt mines, ancient tombs and other attractions.

;

;;;;

;

;The Austrian town of Hallstatt is a World Cultural Heritage , picturesque scenery, and also has ancient salt mines, ancient tombs and other attractions. (Chen Chen/Photo)

;

;But when he actually came to the small town of Hallstatt, Chen Chen’s feelings became different.

;

;"There are so many foreign tourists in that town." Chen Chen's tone unconsciously increased. "Obviously the locals don't like so many tourists." He observed that on the doors of many houses in the town, there would be signs such as "Please do not speak loudly" written on them.

;

;Many reports claim that in just a few years, this village with nearly 800 residents has become a world tourist attraction. It receives around 1 million tourists a year, many of them Asians, "who turn Hallstatt into an important stopover".

;

;Chen Chen remembered that one time, when he was taking pictures of a house, a local suddenly rushed out the door angrily and shouted at Chen Chen, telling him to go away quickly, otherwise he would call the police. "Locals have had enough of large, noisy, disruptive tour groups."

;

;On August 27, 2023, residents took to the streets and blocked tunnels and main roads leading to the entrance to the town. Trying to draw attention to the problem of overtourism.

;

;The roads in the Austrian town are very narrow and crowded with people. Even the restaurants where you eat have long queues.

;

;Chen Chen felt that not only was the restaurant’s service speed slow, but its attitude towards tourists was not very good either. "Indifferent".

;

;On the mountain behind the small town of Hallstatt, there is a historic salt mine. Many foreign tourists come to this internet celebrity check-in place. But to take a small train up the mountain, Chen Chen couldn't wait in line, "because there were too many people."

;

;It is not easy to take pictures in the mountains. "We take advantage of every crack, and the queue order is not particularly good." Chen Chen said that as a photographer, if there are too many passers-by in the shot, he can only change the perspective or rely on post-production to process the pictures.

;

;“Too many tourists have also brought about some derivative problems, such as garbage visible everywhere.” Chen Chen believes that the uncivilized behavior of many foreign tourists will arouse the resentment of local people.

;

;After staying in the Austrian town for half a day, Chen Chen went to another town next door and found that the contrast was obvious.

;

;"It was a very unknown town. It was very quiet, with few tourists. There was only one restaurant in the town." Chen Chen said that when I went there, the restaurant was full of locals dining. The elderly couple patted the empty seat next to them, indicating that Chen Chen could sit down.

;

;Chen Chen found that the local people's lives were very leisurely. They got up late in the morning and everyone had a relaxed expression. The elderly couple said that they don't like too many tourists because they are too noisy, so they have been living in this quiet town.

;

;In addition to the Austrian town, a travel blogger also uploaded some street graffiti in Barcelona, ​​Spain on his social media account. The alleys in the neighborhood were almost covered with the words "Tourists go back to their own homes" The slogan was accompanied by the text "In August, the European tourist season, Barcelona is so crowded that you can't even walk in the alleys."

;

;Such posts quickly aroused a lot of discussion. Lining, a netizen from Spain, explained in the comment area that the slogans sprayed by people in Barcelona are mainly aimed at tourists from Northern Europe. "They party wildly, drink heavily, and urinate everywhere. The streets are always dirty." Lining said that local Barcelona people had to move out because of this.

;

;Media reports said that in protest, residents of the village of Hallstatt also erected a wooden barrier in the town, blocking the view of the Alps. However, the barrier was later removed.

;

;Previously, the mayor of Hallstatt had promised to reduce the number of tourist buses entering the town, but the problem of overtourism persists. Residents are demanding a limit on the number of visitors per day and a curfew on tour buses, which are also not allowed into the city after 5 p.m.

;

;On online social media platforms, many netizens express their understanding of the anti-tourist behavior of international Internet celebrities. They believe that excessive tourists have indeed squeezed the living space of local residents and affected their living environment. It has also increased prices around the scenic area.

;

;“This is a very normal reaction.” Zhou Zhao, head of the European Department of Shenzhen Vanzhong Cultural Tourism, said that international tourism is a “love-hate relationship” for local residents. Love is that tourists can drive the local economy, but hate is that too many tourists will affect the lives of local people.

;

;;"Ultimately make more money from tourists";

;

;Fuzi is a freelance photographer, 2023 I started living in Bali in early September of this year.

;

;Bali is more than a thousand kilometers away from Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia, and is separated from Java Island by only a 3.2-kilometer-wide strait. It covers an area of ​​about more than 5,000 square kilometers. It is the most famous tourist and leisure area in Indonesia. Many travel magazines have voted it "one of the most enchanting holiday destinations in the world".

;

;“The prices of accommodation and food in Bali have increased now,” Fuzi said. In the past, you could rent a large suite with a swimming pool for 2,000 to 3,000 yuan per month in Bali, with good decoration and beautiful scenery. . But after the epidemic is relaxed, you can only rent a single room at a similar price.

;

;Even most restaurants have increased their prices. In the past, for 100 RMB per person, you could have a good Western meal in a restaurant with a nice environment, but now it costs at least 150 RMB. The starting price of a motorcycle has more than doubled from three to four yuan.

;

;Zhou Zhao told Southern Weekend reporters that for popular foreign tourist cities, it is generally necessary to book hotels about two months in advance, and prices have increased by about 30% on average compared to before the epidemic.

;

;According to Bali Province’s tourism statistics, from November 2022 to January 2023, Bali Province welcomed nearly 1 million foreign tourists. According to data released by the Chinese Consulate General in Denpasar, Indonesia, Bali Province receives about 40% of foreign tourists visiting Indonesia.

;

;Due to the nature of her work, Fuzi often has to go out for filming. He bought a motorcycle, but there are often traffic jams on the road in Canggu, sometimes even for thirty or forty minutes.

;

;“The road is very narrow, with a car in the middle and motorcycles jammed on both sides.” Fuzi told Southern Weekend reporters that tourists and locals overlapped, and some traffic jams also caused dust, causing the air to be dirty. good.

;

;;;;

;

;A short and narrow road, sometimes even It will take thirty or forty minutes. (Fuzi/Picture)

;

;However, the car rental fees for foreign tourists in Bali have also increased. In the past, you could rent a motorcycle for 300 yuan, but now it costs 500 yuan.

;

;Zhou Zhao said that this year, as the energy supply of most countries has been affected by the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, prices such as fuel, gas, and electricity are rising, and travel costs have increased. Therefore, some outbound tour group fees It is more expensive due to this reason.

;

;However, for Fuzi, the longer he stays in Bali, the more his favorability decreases.

;

;The gap between the rich and the poor in Bali is large, and some people who rely on tourism have inspired others' desire for money. After the epidemic was relaxed, many people who had houses at home opened B&Bs or shops. In the past, Fuzi felt that most people in Bali were "simple", but now they are more "commercial".

;

;In May of this year, a piece of news about “you need to make a reservation one year in advance if you want to travel to Bali” attracted the attention of the international community. The source is a report from an Indonesian news website that the tourist resort island of Bali plans to impose restrictions on foreign tourists.

;

;Subsequently, Bali Governor Wayan explained to the media that the restrictive measures were implemented mainly to prevent some foreign tourists from staying in the local area on tourist visas and illegally doing business or looking for jobs after running out of money on vacation. In addition, with the recovery of tourism after the epidemic and the arrival of large-scale tourists, some illegal and disrespectful behaviors have also appeared, "causing Bali residents to feel uneasy."

;

;For this plan, Fuzi thinks it is "difficult to implement." Because in Bali, "money is king." He said that both the government and the people of Bali want to develop the economy. The so-called "application restrictions" are only a minor problem as long as the money is available.

;

;Fuzi said that even if it is implemented, prices will not fall back to normal levels. "Because these policies are essentially screening tourists and selecting tourists with better and more stable financial capabilities." Fuzi believes that in this way, tourists can make more money.

;

;However, the following month, Ayu Martini, Indonesia’s Deputy Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, said that as of now, no reservation is required for Bali travel, and Indonesia’s visa policy has not changed.

;

;According to relevant plans previously formulated by the Indonesian government, Indonesia strives to receive 3.5 million to 7.4 million international tourists in 2023, and the foreign exchange revenue from the tourism industry will reach at least 2.07 billion US dollars.

;

;;“The key lies in passenger flow management”;

;

;When Taiwanese youth Chen Zhiwei went to Venice for the first time, In addition to admiring the cityscape, he was also surprised by the number of tourists.

;

;“You can see faces from different countries everywhere in the local area.” Chen Zhiwei said that the most common means of transportation on Venice Island is buses and boats, and each boat is always full of people. "From morning to night."

;

;Venice, this beautiful city known as the "City on the Water", is located on the Adriatic Sea in northeastern Italy. It has always been a tourist attraction for tourists from all over the world.

;

;;

;

;Venice, the "City on the Water", is a tourist attraction for tourists from all over the world. The picture shows tourists on a gondola ride in Venice. (Yao Jiatong/Photo)

;

;However, conflicts occur from time to time.

;

;Once, when Chen Zhiwei was visiting Pisa, he was told at the train station that the last train was temporarily cancelled. Since hundreds of locals and foreign tourists were stranded at the scene, the train station sent a return bus, but it could only accommodate 40 people.

;

;At first, the staff allowed tourists with children to get on the bus first, but this quickly aroused the dissatisfaction of locals who could not get on the bus. They complained that it was all due to too many tourists, causing even the bus to run out of time. Can't sit down.

;

;“Many locals surrounded the bus and refused to let the driver drive away.” Chen Zhiwei said that who got on the bus and who stayed behind became the fuse of conflicts. After physical conflicts broke out between locals and tourists, many police officers were deployed to resolve the issue.

;

;In the end, many tourists, including Chen Zhiwei, could only stay overnight at the train station and wait for the train the next morning.

;

;On September 13, 2023, Venice announced a policy that starting in the spring of 2024, tourists entering the city during peak periods will need to pay 5 euros (approximately 39 yuan).

;

;Previously, the Venetian government hoped that the money could be used to improve residents' facilities and infrastructure. They "had to deal with overflowing bins" and rubbish thrown on the streets by tourists. At its peak, the number of foreign tourists outnumbered locals by about five times.

;

;Chen Zhiwei is accustomed to things like "taxation". For example, when staying in a hotel, many hotels charge a "city tax", which is usually two or three euros a day, and it will be shown on the bill.

;

;"After the money is collected, it will actually be used to help maintain the city and deal with problems arising from tourism." Chen Zhiwei said that it is reasonable for foreign tourists to bear some maintenance costs while traveling. .

;

;External public opinion believes that excessive tourism has caused many locals to leave their hometowns. The introduction of taxes and fees such as "tourism tax" can offset harmful effects such as waste resource pollution.

;

;;

;

;Many netizens complained on social platforms that the difficulty of parking at international celebrity tourist attractions is a thorny issue. (Yao Jiatong/Picture)

;

;Ivan Saprov, founder of the American travel technology company Voyagu, said that sustainability-related charges are not difficult for tourists to accept.

;

;They conducted a survey and found that nearly 40% of tourists said that charging fees was okay and expressed support for this, saying that the income generated could be used to create pleasant experiences for tourists and locals. Facilities and Services.

;

;It is worth noting that in order to restrict foreign tourists, homeless people and other people who spend the night outside, the Venice government has made efforts to install benches in public places.

;

;Chen Zhiwei observed that there was a strange raised shape in the middle of some benches. Locals told him that the purpose of this was to prevent tourists and homeless people from sleeping on the benches and reduce their stay in public areas.

;

;Like Venice, Croatia has introduced "rules" or instructions for tourists to prevent unruly behavior related to drinking. This includes requirements for appropriate attire in historic areas, prohibitions on alcohol consumption and gathering in public places where alcohol is prohibited.

;

;Ina Rodin, director of North America at the Croatian National Tourist Board, said a code of conduct is a way of informing visitors of acceptable behavior at a destination. "But compliance is often limited."

;

;;

;

;Many places set "rules" or instructions to prevent unruly behavior. The picture shows a policeman issuing a ticket at the entrance of an Italian town. (Yao Jiatong/Photo)

;

;In fact, as one of the most famous tourist destinations in the world, Venice’s current core area population is less than 50,000. During peak tourist seasons, the number of tourists sometimes exceeds twice the resident population. The huge foot traffic has caused serious problems over the years.

;

;Zurab Pololikashvili, Secretary-General of the United Nations World Tourism Organization, said in an interview that the key to solving overtourism lies in the management of passenger flow. He noted that new technologies can help solve this problem.

;

;For example, towns in northern Germany use lidar sensors installed on self-driving cars to manage tourist flow. To combat crowding without sacrificing tourism revenue, some countries are attracting tourists to less crowded areas.

;

;;(Southern Weekend intern Bao Jingyue also contributed to this article);

; Mon, 20 Nov 2023 18:25:03 +0800 从民族问题到“赚快钱”，缅北冲突何时休？丨智库视点http://www.infzm.com/contents/260943
;;2023-11-20 17:00:00;
;

;Recently, the conflict in northern Myanmar has attracted attention at home and abroad.

;

;On November 2, 2023, when answering a question from an AFP reporter, Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Wang Wenbin said that China is highly concerned about the conflict situation in northern Myanmar, urges all parties to immediately cease fire and end the war, and insist on dialogue and consultation to resolve the conflict. Resolve differences peacefully, avoid escalation of the situation, and take practical and effective measures to ensure security and stability on the China-Myanmar border.

;

;On November 8, the Myanmar National Governing Council (junta) held a meeting of the National Defense Committee. The Commander-in-Chief of the Myanmar Army, General Min Aung Hlaing, made it clear at the meeting that the attack launched by the Kokang Allied Forces was intended to retake the Kokang. control and regain the benefits of drug production and trafficking, while its allies, the Ta'ang Army and the Kachin Independence Army, also have their own political goals.

;

;Chaos in northern Myanmar, the impact of "making quick money"

;

;Northern Myanmar has been in a state of war for a long time, with a large number of ethnic minority local armed forces, Myanmar government forces and minorities recruited by the government forces. The militia groups transformed from ethnic local armed forces are fighting with each other.

;

;Although the main contradiction exists between the local armed forces of ethnic minorities and the government forces, under certain circumstances, some ethnic minority armed forces will cooperate with the government forces to a certain extent to target other ethnic minority armed forces. ; In some cases, the militia groups recruited by the government forces will turn against the government forces again, so that on the one hand, the government forces need to rely on the support of the militia groups as local people to deal with the local militias; on the other hand, they also maintain a high degree of vigilance against the militia groups, everywhere Limit it to prevent it from getting too big.

;

;The causes of Myanmar’s civil war are long-standing and complex. This involves the need to face the ethnic chieftain system left over from the feudal dynasty in the construction of the Myanmar nation-state, as well as the British colonists' political tactics of strengthening support for ethnic chieftains and countering the majority Bamar ethnic group.

;

;What cannot be ignored is that in the 1960s, after launching a coup and seizing state power, Commander-in-Chief of the Myanmar Army Ne Win adopted an impatient attitude in building a nation-state and tried to divide the national identity into three Sixty-nine and so on, forcibly promoting the assimilation of ethnic minorities.

;

;In the area where ethnic minorities occupy nearly half of Myanmar’s territory, dozens of ethnic minorities who have lived here for generations suddenly became second- and third-class citizens overnight, and even their national identity cannot be guaranteed. What they lose is not only political rights, but also the most basic land property rights.

;

;To this day, this attitude of "the land is important but not the people", which has not been completely changed, is the most fundamental reason for the armed resistance of ethnic minorities in northern and southeastern Myanmar.

;

;Myanmar is not a developed country, and areas inhabited by ethnic minorities such as northern Myanmar are even more remote and underdeveloped. The long-term consumption of war has completely complicated the problem.

;

;Although the Burmese Army recognizes the legitimacy of their political status, in reality, the Burmese Army’s military expenditures are not generous, and the supply of their weapons, equipment and personnel costs is basically better than nothing, which often leads them to “use drugs” "Raise the Army" route.

;

;The Burmese army often adopts a indulgent attitude towards this. If controls are strengthened, it is easy for the vigilante groups to rebel again and become local militants. If the vigilante group collapses immediately, he will also lose a powerful arm. Therefore, this delicate balance is also an important reason for the rampant criminal activities in northern Myanmar.

;

;Due to the shortage of military funds, the income of the military and police at the grassroots level of the Myanmar government is too low. For this reason, Myanmar The military government had to make major changes to the local military and police departments.

;

;The huge profits of drugs are also the reason why the "alternative cultivation" model that the international community once seriously promoted has made occasional progress in northern Myanmar, but has always had little effect. If we can find another way to "make quick money" that is not so eye-catching to the world and is as profitable as the drug trade, this will be quite attractive to various ethnic groups.

;

;Therefore, in the past ten years, when "online gambling" was hit hard again, it quickly turned into widespread electronic fraud.

;

;Today, on the one hand, the Kokang Allied Forces will indeed deal a heavy blow to the electronic fraud problem in northern Myanmar; on the other hand, it may also make the future situation in Myanmar more complicated.

;

;Each one has his or her own agenda

;

;Although the Kokang area is only a tiny corner of the country compared to the whole of Myanmar, judging from the scope of this war, it is obviously beyond The scope of boldness. ;

;

; Secondly, the natural and humanistic conditions of northern Myanmar are quite limited. If these areas are independent, it is difficult to form a pillar industry in addition to minerals, and the lack of self -support in finance. There will be problems with social governance capabilities. In addition, the existence of a large number of cross -border ethnic groups in the region will eventually cause domestic contradictions and affect regional stability.

;

; Finally, the consequences of the split Myanmar may seriously affect regional stability.

;

; Can it "crushed"

;

; In the past, the reason why the Burmese army was able to show the crushing trend of the civilian military organizations mainly depends on the advantages and resource advantages in the Burmese region. The only obstacle that is not easy to overcome is the geographical situation in the civil area. This advantage has been greatly weakened after the "2 · 1 coup" in 2020.

;

; The Democratic League government has a very powerful appeal within Myanmar, especially the Burmese. The coup of the Burmese army has caused severe division within the Burmese and seriously weakening the sustainable war of the Burmese army.

;

; From the perspective of military forces, the Burmese Army can indeed increase troops on a large scale in theory to solve the danger of beyond the city. .

;

;

;

; For Myanmar, in the future, the Burmese army may be able to reach a certain compromise with the civilians of the civilians through political negotiations, and then turn around to focus on the Baojun.

;

; The Burmese Army and the NLD forces reached a compromise. This may cause Myanmar for a long time to be roughly stable, but various small conflicts will be one after another. This is also a tragedy for Myanmar itself, which means that the people of Myanmar must bear more pain, but it is better than the state of division and losing autonomy.

;

; There is also a result that is less likely but also exists. After the Burmese realizes internal reconciliation, the Burmese army finally relies on its own volume advantage to completely suppress civil land in a certain period of time, at least at least, at least In the form of form.

;

; In the future, the autonomy of the northern Myanmar nation will be effectively guaranteed, especially the power between the central government of Myanmar and the local autonomous government of the ethnic minority is clearly divided, which can ensure the development and the development of northern Myanmar ethnic minorities regions and The development of the Burmese region is the fundamental move that truly eliminates the sources of trouble in this area.

; However, this idea is still the air tower before today's Myanmar politics and social reality.

; Mon, 20 Nov 2023 17:55:04 +0800 “中华老字号”不是护身符：历史招牌只是其表，商业信誉才是其里丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/260947
;;2023-11-20 16:00:00;
;

;Recently, the Ministry of Commerce and other five departments issued the "Notice on Announcement of the Review Results of Chinese Time-honored Brands", which will lead to long-term poor management. , or even 55 brands that have gone bankrupt, canceled, closed down, or lost the ownership and use rights of time-honored registered trademarks, have been removed from the list of Chinese time-honored brands; 73 brands with poor operations and declining performance are required to be rectified within 6 months; 1,000 brands will continue to be retained A brand with standardized operations and good development.

;

;"Chinese time-honored brand" is not only a title/title, but also an officially certified identity/qualification. The "remove, rectify, and retain" measures taken by the five departments to "remove, rectify, and retain" "Chinese time-honored brands" just allow the outside world to rethink the true connotation of "Chinese time-honored brands" and analyze the right and wrong behind "Chinese time-honored brands".

;

;The official definition of the so-called "Chinese time-honored brands" refers to "long history, products, skills or services that have been passed down from generation to generation, with a distinctive traditional Chinese cultural background and profound cultural heritage, and have gained widespread social recognition." recognition and form a brand with good reputation.” From the literal meaning, "inherited from generation to generation" can be interpreted as "historical and cultural traditional value", while "products, skills or services are widely recognized by society" can be reduced to "commercial reputation and market status", which is also the construction of "Chinese time-honored brands". "Two pillars.

;

;The connotation of "Chinese time-honored brands" is the "traditional cultural background and profound cultural heritage" behind it, or is it the market position and business reputation won in competition? The two cases in this notice can be said to be the answer to this question.

;

;Among the "time-honored brands" that have been removed from the list, Inner Mongolia Dashengkui and Anhui Beggar Chicken are two typical cases: Dashengkui lasted for hundreds of years from the Kangxi period of the Qing Dynasty to the Anti-Japanese War. "Yin Yuan Bao Pu" ruled two thousand miles of trade routes in Mongolia. When it resumed business more than ten years ago, it also placed many people's expectations on reviving the old brand; Anhui beggar's chicken is said to date back to the Hongwu period of the Ming Dynasty. Although this legend is false and true , but the reason why it was expelled from the "time-honored brand" is not its historical and cultural authenticity, but its poor management in recent years.

;

;It is not difficult to see that the history of Dashengkui is more authentic, but this does not save it from the bad luck of being "delisted"; Anhui Beggar Chicken has doubts about its history and culture alone, but the last thing that crushed it The straw is probably not an academic verification of authenticity, but a defeat in the competition in the modern catering market. In fact, there is more than one "Beggar's Chicken". The "Daoxiang Village" and "Guanshengyuan" that have been removed from the list this time also have brands with the same name. The reason why they failed to pass the review of "Chinese Time-honored Brands" is not because of "historical and cultural traditional value" "Something went wrong.

;

;In fact, for these "Chinese time-honored brands", if they cannot embrace the latest changes in the market and cannot innovate themselves to meet the needs of consumers, they will inevitably die out; conversely, if a brand can Create brand new products and services, and even if they are not old, they will slowly occupy the minds of consumers and become a new tradition.

;

;Western academic circles have long noticed the phenomenon of "invention of tradition": those "traditions" that appear or claim to be ancient often originate quite recently, and are sometimes even invented. . This is not uncommon in the Chinese context, which is the common phenomenon of "replying family trees" and "recognizing ancestors". The "traditional origins" recognized by many "time-honored brands" are often suspected of being attached to others in academic circles.

;

;Facts have proved that whether a tradition really has historical and cultural continuity value and whether it is really academically tenable is not determined by whether the tradition is widely accepted. The key factor is not even important. Regardless of these "time-honored brands", even emerging companies that have not been established for a long time often have to make some "inventions" and even "legends" in the "brand story", but no consumer will be like a professional historian. If we continue to delve deeper into how much of this is true and how false, we will be more inclined to spread these wonderful stories.

;

;Such cases abound in China, Europe and the United States. The history of "A diamond is forever, a diamond will last forever" is actually not that long ago, but this advertising slogan and the brand value behind it seem to have existed since ancient times. The untenable "tradition" can still win over consumers. The "Eight Major Cuisines" often claim to have thousands of years of history, but their true origins can often only be traced back to the mid-Qing Dynasty. However, this has not affected the reputation of the major cuisines. After all, food must be felt by the tip of the tongue, and consumers I don't care much about whether its history is true.

;

;Of course, this does not mean that the authenticity of "time-honored brands" is not important at all. "Century-old stores" that "look fake at first glance" will still make people see through their tricks, and then be suspected of false propaganda. In other words, only the quality of goods and services, consumer choices, and market judgment can enable a company and its brand to gain business credibility, consolidate the company's brand value, help companies spread their own brand stories, and let "time-honored" brands The brand stands. If a "time-honored brand" becomes a company's "talisman" and makes the company feel that it can "win" by relying on it, and even relies on the brand's long-standing mass base to not improve its business management and pay attention to the quality of its products and services, then the result will be in name only. I can't even keep my name.

;

;Therefore, for a "time-honored enterprise", the directory and trademark are only the surface, and long-lasting business reputation is the inside. A "Chinese time-honored brand" can maintain its business reputation not by a directory or a trademark, but by the sincere recognition of it as a traditional Chinese brand by consumers. The changes of the times will eliminate some "time-honored brands", retain some time-honored brands, and also create a number of new "time-honored brands".

;Recently, milk tea in Xinjiang has become a hot topic.

;Some netizens posted pictures showing that when buying milk tea in Xinjiang, a cup starts at 1kg, triggering heated discussions among the public about the "bigness" of Xinjiang.

;The air in Xinjiang seems to be filled with baking powder, and food will "expand" several times once it arrives in Xinjiang. For example, 10 kinds of Xinjiang delicacies, including Xinjiang’s No. 1 Nang, Big Plate of Chicken, Noodle Soup for Ten Thousands of People, Largest Oil Cake Tower, and Rice Pilaf for Ten Thousand People, have all set Guinness World Records for their “bigness”. ; Mon, 20 Nov 2023 15:25:03 +0800 “永恒”的敌人：未了案横跨八十年，谁的“王洛宾”？http://www.infzm.com/contents/260885

;

;;

;

;September 11, 2023, Zhuozhou, Hebei Province, Wang Haicheng's manuscript of "In That Distant Place". (Southern Weekend reporter Su Youpeng/Photo)

;

;A stage play

;

;;Only a few people realize that everything they enjoy at the moment is facing unprecedented challenges. ;

;

;A quarter of an hour before 7:30, outside the West Second Ring Road in Beijing, a group of children and parents gathered in front of the Erqi Theater. It was a cool evening in early September, and the new version of the red children's drama "The Ballad of Soybean" began its national tour here.

;

;Some Chinese people are familiar with this story. In 1940, the Gansu Provincial Working Committee of the Communist Party of China was destroyed. Luo Lili, who was 8 months old, was arrested at the same time as his parents. After several twists and turns, he was imprisoned in Lanzhou Dashagou Prison, where he spent 6 years. Wang Luobin, who was also in prison, asked Luo Lili what the most delicious food in the world was. Luo Lili, who had never been exposed to the outside world, thought it was broad beans that he had eaten by chance. Wang Luobin composed the song "Soybean Ballad" from this.

;

;A while after leaving the venue, the crowd suddenly surrounded an old man.

;

;The old man has appeared on CCTV 13 times. On TV, he is smart, wise, and tall. He is proud that he "didn't make a single mistake" when talking. ", and sometimes, I even have to play and sing "In That Distant Place" on the stage.

;

;But the old man in front of him has droopy eye bags and a lot of white hair on his sparse head. He kept taking out performance tickets from the small shoulder bag on his chest, a total of 40 tickets, which belonged to "old friends" he had met through cooperation in the name of his father.

;

;Most of these "old friends" reached the peak of their careers in the 1990s. They had their own programs in top media and were able to open solo concerts in the most central concert hall in Beijing. Concert, organize a commemorative concert for Wang Luobin in the most famous building.

;

;There are also officials from Zhuozhou, Hebei. This county-level city with a population of 650,000 has a 30-square-meter former residence of Wang Luobin and a Wang Luobin Chorus. The director of Zhuozhou Culture and Tourism Bureau and the director of the cultural center drove 60 kilometers to come.

;

;He is the youngest son of Wang Luobin, the "King of Western Singers". Wang Luobin's ancestral home is in Zhuozhou, and a new Wang Luobin Music Memorial Hall is about to be renovated in an old factory in the north of the city as a local cultural landmark.

;

;Wang Luobin, who will appear on the stage in a quarter of an hour, is a "prisoner" who has to go through several political movements before he can be called the King of Singers in the future. , Prison Years, and Social Change.

;

;Wang Luobin's 83-year ups and downs often give playwrights a headache. He once participated in the Northwest Anti-Japanese War Theater Troupe with Xiao Jun, Seke and others. He was also highly appreciated by the warlord Ma Bufang and formed a children's theater troupe in Qinghai. During China's darkest period, he captured a hint of romanticism, and some of the songs he was most proud of in his life were born here, including "In That Distant Place" and "Youth Dance."

;

;At half past seven, "Soybean Ballad" started. I got a chance to film Wang Haicheng, a documentary director who has been following him for more than ten years. The film is called "Looking for Wang Luobin".

;

;For the "old friends" in the audience, some people want to promote this drama to a bigger stage, and some people want to make a movie related to Wang Luobin. , two people respectively proposed to build a music school named after the king of singers in Hebei and Hainan.

;

;They all need to obtain authorization from Wang Haicheng. Only a few people realize that everything the son of the King of Songs enjoys at the moment is facing unprecedented challenges.

;

;;

;

;September 11, 2023 On the same day, in Zhuozhou, Hebei Province, Wang Haicheng displayed his published biography of Wang Luobin and audio-visual products. (Southern Weekend reporter Su Youpeng/Photo)

;

;SON OF THE SINGER

;

;;Family has never been a place where the singer is willing to devote his attention;

;

;Wang Haicheng has spent half his life defending his father's honor.

;

;Wang Luobin has two marriages, three sons and several loves. Among the three sons, the eldest went to Australia in the 1980s. The second child was a truck driver and died of illness. After surviving a period of history, the four fathers and sons now only have the third child left. Therefore, interviews, authorizations, rights protection, concerts, commemorations, and publications all fell on Wang Haicheng.

;

;In fact, for a long time, the identity of "Wang Luobin's son" made Wang Haicheng breathless. When he was 8 months old, Wang Luobin was arrested, followed by a search of his home. A month later, his mother passed away in the hospital bed. Relatives in Beijing did not dare to have contact with the Wang family. After hearing about it, the fifth uncle in Zhuozhou drove a carriage all day and night from Beijing in the early winter in the north to bring the body back from Beijing and bury it in a wheat field.

;

;A few years ago, Wang Haicheng tried to find his mother's tomb, but he could no longer find it.

;

;Studying stopped in the second grade of junior high school. When it was time to go to the mountains and countryside, Wang Haicheng stayed on the farm for nine years because of Wang Luobin. When groups of educated young people returned to the city one after another, he also got a nickname: "Cushionzi". This dialect refers to the last puppy out of a litter.

;

;Family is never a place where the singer is willing to devote his attention. Wang Haicheng wrote that the union between his father and his mother was due to the breakup of his father's previous relationship, so he wanted to take revenge on his life. Wang Luobin was born free. He went to the grassland, to the market, and even in prison, collecting folk songs. A producer who visited the singer's deeds mentioned a detail. In his later years, Wang Luobin rode a bicycle everywhere. When it got dark, he would lie on the road and fall asleep, and then go home the next day.

;

;Wang Luobin passed away in 1996. Wang Haicheng immediately joined the China Music Copyright Association and registered 207 musical works recorded, organized and created by Wang Luobin with the association. He became increasingly aware that his father had left a shining legacy. Since 2000, Wang Haicheng has successively published two biographies of Wang Luobin, a song sheet of Wang Luobin, invested in TV films, and a long narrative poem. Four exhibition halls have been created in Turpan, Xinjiang, Haibei, Qinghai, Baishui Ancient Town, Dabancheng, Xinjiang, and Liupan Mountain, Ningxia.

;

;It is difficult to say how father's love plays a subtle role in Wang Haicheng's life. In order to guard this heritage, he was like an ascetic, stationed in the Grape Valley of the Flame Mountain for 16 years.

;

;In the first few years of the 21st century, the Turpan Wang Luobin Music and Art Museum in Grape Valley was the only temple to commemorate the king of singers. This building has an Ottoman-style white circular dome and 80 panels displaying the singer's life. Visitors came in the 40℃ high temperature. When they opened the door, they saw the sweaty son of the singer wearing a shirt with Wang Luobin's logo in front of him. There were biographies, song collections, tapes and records on the counter. When the operation of the art museum was most difficult, Wang Haicheng went to bring in strange stones from the Gobi Desert that looked like pork belly and English letters. This is the most popular commodity in Xinjiang’s tourism market.

;

;He also set up an incense burner in front of his father's portrait - Wang Luobin converted to Buddhism in his later years. There was once a man who claimed to be a physicist and kowtowed three times directly to the portrait.

;

;Wang Haicheng honed his speaking skills, pondered the details of his father's life, paid attention to his image, and never refused any opportunity to appear in the national media. The comment that moved him most came from an old man from Shandong: "Wang Haicheng, you are the biggest filial son in China."

;

;;

;

;On July 24, 2022, Wang Luobin Music Art Museum is located in Grape Valley, Turpan, Xinjiang. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;Salvage and Debate

;

;;Changing one note, two notes, or a chorus counts as "adaptation"? ;

;

;In the 1990s, a modern storm swept through Urumqi: the most cutting-edge local popular music came from further west. Ethnic minorities hold weekly house music gatherings. Seven days and nights after the song "Forgetting Love Water" reached Urumqi, the shops in the Grand Bazaar would use rough-sounding speakers to play versions in other languages. The bars all over the street are full of singing bands. On the radio, the male host can talk endlessly about the Beatles, Tchaikovsky and Rachmaninoff.

;

;Yibo, the director of "Looking for Wang Luobin", was the popular host of the Urumqi Economic Radio program "Music Leisure Island" at the time. After more than 20 years, she believes that Urumqi at that time showed tolerance for all kinds of music and was the "center of Asian music."

;

;But there is no local singer's name in popular music. His limelight comes from outside Urumqi.

;

;Wang Luobin was rediscovered in the context of an era where order was brought to order. In May 1981, on an afternoon when the temperature suddenly soared to 33°C and the snow suddenly melted, in a five- to six-square-meter concierge at the Qianjin Theater, Xinhua News Agency reporter Zhao Quanzhang met Wang Luobin, who had just been released from prison. In Zhao Quanzhang's reminiscence article, this person who looked like Quasimodo in "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" was unemployed, had no household registration, and did not even have "food and oil connections."

;

;Zhao Quanzhang wrote the internal reference for Wang Luobin, and soon received instructions from Song Renqiong, then head of the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. Zhao Quanzhang once recalled that the work of bringing order to the country was not completely smooth at that time. The resolution of Wang Luobin's problem had an impact on Xinjiang and the whole country.

;

;Openness was the theme of the 1980s. And for a musician who has experienced the war of resistance, prison, and rehabilitation, is there any symbol more suitable to glimpse a country's path of exploration?

;

;In the autumn of 1988, "Eight Thousand Miles to the Clouds and the Moon" hosted by Taiwanese artist Ling Feng went to Xinjiang to interview Wang Luobin. This was the first program from the other side to introduce China. TV programs about mainland China’s customs and customs. Then, Xia Jie, a female writer from Hong Kong, China, also came to visit and wrote three articles. Soon, Singapore, Australia, North America, and overseas Chinese had someone to pay attention to.

;

;The media calls him the King of Western Singers and enjoys special government subsidies. China Record Corporation awarded him the Golden Record Special Creation Award, and UNESCO awarded him the "Promote "Special Contribution Award for Cultural Exchange between East and West". But all medals are inferior to the gifts given by the people. In the era when the word "fan" only refers to fans, Wang Luobin's most proud example is, "Chinese friends said that at least half of the two million Chinese in the United States can sing. "In that distant place"".

;

;A more well-known story is that Sanmao, a female writer from Taiwan, China, moved directly into the home of the singer, and scandals abounded.

;

;Trouble is coming quietly. One day in 1993, Luo Dayou's agent called. Not long ago, Rolling Stone Records released the tape "Love Song Anniversary - Luo Dayou and Wang Luobin's Great Collaboration of the Century" without Wang Luobin's consent. The King of Songs was very angry and took Luo Dayou to court for infringement of his copyright.

;

;Greater controversy ensued. Someone revealed that Ling Feng paid 20,000 yuan to buy out ten of Wang Luobin's songs, including "In That Faraway Place", "The Girl from Dabancheng", "Mayila" and "Youth Dance".

;

;The music issue soon turned into a political issue. Someone asked, can Wang Luobin sell folk songs that belong to the people?

;

;A major discussion that lasted for more than a year began. In June 1994, "People's Music" magazine began to discuss the copyright issue of Wang Luobin's folk songs. Dai Penghai, an associate researcher at the Shanghai Conservatory of Music, published two articles criticizing the news media for hyping up Wang Luobin, and also accused Wang Luobin of "selling out the people's sovereignty and interests in national music culture."

;

;There are also people who support Wang Luobin. Liu Zaisheng, a professor at the Music Department of Shandong Normal University, pointed out that “collecting brotherly ethnic songs in different languages ​​is a more complex and difficult task, and the translation and dubbing of lyrics often plays a key role in success or failure.” And “if we combine the When the lyrics are analyzed together, it is not difficult to find that they have formed Wang Luobin's unique creative style that is lyrical, colloquial, and popular."

;

;Another background to the great discussion is that during China's "resumption of customs" negotiations, the Copyright Law was promulgated in 1991, which stipulates that "adaptation, translation, The copyright of works resulting from the annotation and arrangement of existing works shall be enjoyed by the person who adapted, translated, annotated and arranged them." In other words, if Wang Luobin "adapts, translates, annotates, and organizes" folk songs, the copyright of the new songs belongs to him.

;

;But, does changing one note, two notes, or a chorus count as "adaptation"?

;

The person presiding over the meeting was Qiao Jianzhong, then director of the Music Research Institute of the China Academy of Arts.
